articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's envoy, Keith Kellogg, on Wednesday scolded a top Russian official for stoking fears of World War Three after Trump warned President Vladimir Putin was playing with fire over Ukraine.
articles.title: U.S. scolds Russia for stoking WW3 fears after Trump's 'playing with fire' remark

articles.author: Sarah Marsh
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy landed in Berlin on Wednesday for talks with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz, his office said, part of a diplomatic drive to end the war in Ukraine, Europe's deadliest since World War Two.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy lands in Berlin for talks with Merz on ending the war

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin's conditions for ending the war in Ukraine include a demand that Western leaders pledge in writing to stop enlarging NATO eastwards and lift a chunk of sanctions on Russia.
articles.title: Exclusive: Putin, for Ukraine peace, wants a pledge to halt NATO enlargement, sources say

articles.author: Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: Sol remembers her first kill for a Mexican cartel: a kidnapping she committed with a handful of other young recruits that twisted into torture and bled into murder. She was 12 years old.
articles.title: How Mexico's cartels recruit children and groom them into killers

articles.author: Greg Torode
articles.description: Satellite imagery shows China landed two of its most advanced bombers in the disputed Paracel islands in the South China Sea this month - a gesture that some analysts described as Beijing's latest signalling of its growing military capabilities to rivals.
articles.title: Exclusive: China's most advanced bombers seen on disputed South China Sea island

articles.author: Olena Harmash, Vlad Smilianets
articles.description: Mariupol natives Oleksandr and Liudmyla Lytvyn fled home three years ago during Russia's 86-day siege of the port city in southern Ukraine. Now they are following peace talks between the warring countries anxiously, fearing they may never return.
articles.title: Many Ukrainians baulk at conceding land to Russia, entangling nascent peace process

articles.author: Yimou Lee, Ben Blanchard
articles.description: Since early May, China deployed fleets larger than usual near Taiwan, the southern Japanese islands and the East and South China Seas.
articles.title: Exclusive: China flexes military muscle with East Asian naval activity, sources say

articles.author: John Irish
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron is leaning towards recognising a Palestinian state, but diplomats and experts say such a move may prove a premature and ineffective way to pressure Israel into moving towards a peace deal with the Palestinians.
articles.title: Macron navigates rocky path to recognising Palestinian state

articles.author: Leigh Thomas
articles.description: French taxi drivers are protesting regularly over proposed government cuts to cash for ferrying patients to and from medical appointments, highlighting the challenge Prime Minister Francois Bayrou faces as he seeks to slash next year's budget.
articles.title: French taxi protests test PM's budget-cutting resolve

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron on Wednesday reaffirmed his wish to see a two-state solution to the Israel-Palestinian conflict and said there were no double standards in French policy towards the Middle East.
articles.title: France wants Palestinian two-state solution, Macron says
